name: Hotel Liberty

reviews.text: Just off Wenceslas Square & with Metro station entrance next door, location was excellent. Great room with excellent bathroom. Breakfast buffet OK, but lacked a bit of variety. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Excellent location

reviews.text: This hotel is in a very convenient position, in a pedestrian area which means it has a very peaceful atmosphere. The room we stayed in was well equiped and spotlessly clean. The tourist sites of the old town are close at hand. The cafe attached to the hotel has a friendly atmosphere and good food. The hotel staff were very proffesional and friendly and the level of service was excellent.
reviews.title: Fantastic location and staff!

reviews.text: We had long weekend in Prague in September and it was great. Prague is very beautiful town and our hotel was so lovely and people were so friendly and very helpful so we felt like we are very special and famous people.
reviews.title: Absolutely Fabulous

reviews.text: We had normal room but it was so lovely that we thought they did give us deluxe room by mistake. Room was so big but so tastefully done that if felt very homely and cosy.
reviews.title: Nice stay in hotel Liberty
complaint
reviews.text: Location was so perfect that we could walk everywhere. And because the hotel is not huge but not small it was just perfect for us to find it and had a great time. Also sauna and pool was very nice specially after day of walking around all tourist attraction. And italian food and then coffee after was so delicious that we could not wait for next day.

reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel
reviews.text: Just spend 4 days in Prague, a beautiful city and the excellent hotel Liberty. We booked the hotel on the internet for just £30 per night and arrived to be greeted by marble floors and the brightest, cleanest and classiest hotel i have stayed in. Situated off Wenceslas square and just a 10 min walk to the old town and charles bridge, it was a relaxing hotel, with excellent service, a good breakfast of cheeses, ham, salami, cereals, breads juices, and coffee. I would recommend the Liberty Hotel to anyone.

reviews.title: Hotel Liberty was great!
reviews.text: Hotel Liberty in Prague was great! My husband and I just got back from spending 3 days and 2 nites there while in Prague. It's a perfect location , especially if you are only going to be there a short time like us. Beautiful rooms, friendly staff. The only negative I would say is that they charged 12 Euro to use the 'Relaxation Room' (the excersise room) and since we were paying $200 USA Dollars a nite I thought that was not necessary.

reviews.title: Loved Prague
reviews.text: We recently stayed 4 nights in Prague and truly had a delightful experience. The Hotel Liberty just off Wencelas Square was home for us and I would highly recommend it. The staff were so helpful, and the accommodation was luxurious. It is a city full of beautiful Architecture, delicious food, and so many spires that we lost count. A climb to the top of Petrin Hill ( we took the Funicular Railway) to see the City from a height is spectacular. WE took a walking tour of the city ( approx 4.5 Hrs) which was really worthwhile, our English speaking guide was excellent and we took in all of the main sites.

reviews.title: Fantastic
reviews.text: I would recommend Prague as one of Europes most beautiful cities and definitely worth taking the time to explore it ... pack good flat walking shoes !!!!!

reviews.title: Great location, good price
reviews.text: Hotel Liberty was an absolute delight. THe location is excellent - a moments walk through the enchanting roads of the Old Town through to the Old Town Square.

description: 4 Star Hotel Liberty is located in Prague historical center, on a pedestrian area near the famous Wenceslas Square. The luxury Hotel came to it´s existence as a result of a careful and sophisticated reconstruction of a Art Nouveau palace built in the year 1894. Some hotel rooms offer a balcony or terrace, hotel suites are laid out on two levels and guests can enjoy a charming view of the Prague Castle. Hotel Liberty is a cosy and intimate hotel in central which has all that a demanding guest might need. A modern Wellness Centre is located in the basement of the hotel. Guests can also relax in the hotel´s open terrace.On the ground floor you will find the excellent Caffetteria Liberty, designed in the same pleasant and elegant style. The hotel has barrier-free entrance and although located on a pedestrian area, guests arriving in their own vehicles are allowed to access very close to the hotel, and the bellboy will help them with the lagguages.The guest can take advantage of safe parking in the garage only 10 minutes walking distance. Try yourself the accommodation at Hotel Liberty in Prague city centre and we will make your stay unforgettable.
